snippet.textDisplay:
All the Sega Genesis games sounded the same for some reason. It's like it had 3 built in instrument sounds that everybody and their brother used. 

I love this game, but in all honesty the SNES beat the shit out of the Sega Genesis when it comes to game music.

All the Sega Genesis games sounded the same for some reason. It's like it had 3 built in instrument sounds that everybody and their brother used.

snippet.textDisplay: Why does it seem that in all the classic Sonic games, one of the hardest zones was always the second one?  Think about it, we have this, Marble Zone, Hydrocity, and Flying Battery.  It's like they start you off easy with a nice grassy stage and then BAM!  Shit gets serious.
snippet.textOriginal: Why does it seem that in all the classic Sonic games, one of the hardest zones was always the second one?  Think about it, we have this, Marble Zone, Hydrocity, and Flying Battery.  It's like they start you off easy with a nice grassy stage and then BAM!  Shit gets serious.

snippet.textDisplay: All due respect to Mario and Megaman, but Sonic had the greatest music in the oldschool era...well possibly ever actually!!! Ahhh the memories...Please get me back there, I'll do a deal with Satan if need be. Who do I have to kill???

snippet.textDisplay:
@yatah 

Really?  This song just drips with 80's classic rock/hard rock.  It's got that nice bluesy feel that would be perfect for guitar.   I agree that the song isn't that hard to play on guitar (I can play it, and I'm not an expert by any means).
snippet.textOriginal:
@yatah 

Really?  This song just drips with 80's classic rock/hard rock.  It's got that nice bluesy feel that would be perfect for guitar.   I agree that the song isn't that hard to play on guitar (I can play it, and I'm not an expert by any means).

snippet.textDisplay: I was'nt a sonic kid, but a played it every now and then at a friend's house. One thing that has allways baffeled me is that somehow Sonic fans seem to like the Green Hill Zone theme better then this one. It might be because there is'nt any save function and the Green Hill Zone theme got etched into their brains, but for me this is the best song of the Sonic games.
snippet.textOriginal: I was'nt a sonic kid, but a played it every now and then at a friend's house. One thing that has allways baffeled me is that somehow Sonic fans seem to like the Green Hill Zone theme better then this one. It might be because there is'nt any save function and the Green Hill Zone theme got etched into their brains, but for me this is the best song of the Sonic games.

snippet.textDisplay: This song was always a badass tune... it didn't hurt that you could get going so fast in this level you could run off the right side of the screen.  The music fit perfectly with the crazy speed possible in the level.

snippet.textDisplay: There's a trick that's hard to get, but I use it all the time now to get past the purple fluid. You gotta take the top path, and when you get to the ramp past the twin loop de loops... jump while you're still on the ramp! The speed will carry you up and you should land past the fluid area.
snippet.textOriginal: There's a trick that's hard to get, but I use it all the time now to get past the purple fluid. snippet.textDisplay:
I don't care what everybody say. But to me Sonic jumped the shark after this zone. No other Sonic stage in 2D or 3D form came close to matching the speed, insanity, and Audiovisual bliss of the Chemical Plant zone.

Chemical Plant Zone made me believe in Blast Processing in 92.
snippet.textOriginal:
I don't care what everybody say. But to me Sonic jumped the shark after this zone. No other Sonic stage in 2D or 3D form came close to matching the speed, insanity, and Audiovisual bliss of the Chemical Plant zone.

Chemical Plant Zone made me believe in Blast Processing in 92.

snippet.textDisplay: The PS1 was on par with the N64 game library wise.  I had both systems and they both had amazing exclusive games with great gameplay.  Graphics were about even until the last couple years of each consoles' lifespan when the CD format allowed the PS1 to look better.  Xbox started the "Omg epic graphics, shitty/cookiecutter gameplay..." mentality that plagues the industry today.  I would say the last great system was the PS2 since people are still buying it today even with the 360 and PS3 out.
snippet.textOriginal: The PS1 was on par with the N64 game library wise.  I had both systems and they both had amazing exclusive games with great gameplay.  Graphics were about even until the last couple years of each consoles' lifespan when the CD format allowed the PS1 to look better.  Xbox started the "Omg epic graphics, shitty/cookiecutter gameplay..." mentality that plagues the industry today.  I would say the last great system was the PS2 since people are still buying it today even with the 360 and PS3 out.

snippet.textDisplay:
That's true. The new stuff is awful. But I am currently applying to contribute to a fanproject called "Sonic 2 HD", where they try to make a HD version of Sonic 2, complete with new artwork, music and all.
I dunno, Mario's just nothing special for me. Of course, everything about Mario screams nostalgia and epicness to a wider public, much more than Sonic, but Sonic's just better for me personally because ... well, yeah. See above. :D
snippet.textOriginal:
That's true. The new stuff is awful. But I am currently applying to contribute to a fanproject called "Sonic 2 HD", where they try to make a HD version of Sonic 2, complete with new artwork, music and all.
I dunno, Mario's just nothing special for me. Of course, everything about Mario screams nostalgia and epicness to a wider public, much more than Sonic, but Sonic's just better for me personally because ... well, yeah. See above. :D
